dialogue.speech: I care nothing for the gods.
The leonals make much of their military might.
Who can know all the mysteries of the Maze? Not I.
Who is that?
Who is that?
That is the name of the chieftain of the gnolls. Strong but not too bright, that one.
My plants tell me that Glaucus is a very good gardener.
Imogen is my name.
He is watching.
Ha ha ha ha. There are many merchants in town.

Those thieving bastards, living off the hard work of others. They would like to believe that they run affairs here in Ichiba, but the truth is that their mercenaries serve only as long as the money flows.
If that's what you want, you should seek it.
In your dreams.
I care nothing for the gods.
The leonal generals reputation precedes him.
He is the leader of the thieves guild. A dangerous man.
The gnome tinker runs a store in town.
His shop is in town.

Seven deadly spirits of pain and conflict dwell in the wastelands... always seven. I have heard of a dragon and a dead man. Of a hunter and a wizard. Of the twin sisters of horror. And of a demon who can laugh. Myself, I prefer to stay here in the Crater.
He is a creature of the night.
The little folk have built their warren to the south. They are cunning artificers and workers of minor magicks.
The Realm is what you make of it.
The gnolls are a fierce, proud people. Many in this Realm take them lightly - but I do not.
Yes, I am Imogen.
That small minded man! He cares for nothing but profit.
Ichiba is a grubby town - but the best this Realm has to offer.
Yes.
I care nothing for the gods.
He is in the temple of The Lady, in town.
Who is that?
The undying fey, how I envy them.
The king of the gnomes hides under the ground.
His inn is in town. He is one of Pickett's men.
Greetings.
It is a mystic woodland world.
You would like to know what is there? Fear and death, little more. The library in Hail had a book... but that city has fallen now.
Who is that?
Who is that?
I care little for the First Realm. No doubt it is much like here.
The shaman of the gnolls is more cunning than he looks.

Hail was in the wastelands, but it has fallen to the Maze. Like a living thing, the Maze direct its creatures at settlements and people within it. Hail lies in ruins now, an ancient dragon brooding amongst the lesser beasts.
Who is that?
Indeed.
I care nothing for the gods.
The gnome city is to the south.
Goodbye.
I care nothing for the gods.
The criminal elements in Ichiba are well organised. They and the Chamber Of Commerce keep each other very busy.
The leonal castle is north of Ichiba.

You seek the Great Gate? No doubt. Well, you have a hard road ahead. It lies beyond the caves called Ilast, which themselves are beyond the wastelands. There used to be a city in the wastes called Hail, but many years ago it fell to the creatures of the Maze.
I care nothing for the gods.
The grey god of the wayfarer, patron of heroes. The bat, the cat and spider are holy to him.
The leonals pride themselves on their military might. They have little time for peace and tolerance, and less for the beauty of nature. I hope to change that.
I can add little to your knowledge.
I do not know that person.
I do not know that person.
I do not know that person.
I hear that a dragon rules over the ruins of Hail.

My name is Lorelei. I am a follower of the old druidic ways, a guardian of the forests and animals. The leonals banished me from their lands because I spoke of peace and tolerance with other peoples. For now, I tend my sanctuary here in secret.
A name out of the legends. They say he, or it, is the Maze made visible. A terrible foe, should you encounter him.
I have little to offer other than peace.
They run Ichiba.
The struggle is more important that the goal.
That is impolite.
He is the dark god of the underworld.
He is the leonal leader. A proud and ambitious spirit, with little room for compromise. He banished me from these lands a year ago.
I do not know that person.
I do not know that person.
I do not know that person.

You will have to pass through the wastelands to reach the Great Gate. Legend has it that the wastes are inhabited by seven spirits of woe, each taking a different form, and he who would pass the Gate must defeat each of them in turn.
I do not know that person.
The little folk are diggers of holes, makers of machines, workers of illusion and enchantment.
Welcome to the Second Realm. Here in the Crater, civilisation survives. Beyond lie the wastelands.

I know the gnolls, they have a village near Ichiba.

They are a primitive folk, closer to nature than most others in this Realm.
I have heard of the sorceress at Ichiba. I fear she seeks dark secrets, secrets that should be better left alone.
I do not know that person.
A boil of a city, built on blood and tears, choking with mud and smoke.
My pleasure.
She is the messenger goddess.
I do not know that person.
I do not know that person.
I do not know the way to the fey lands.
The gnome king is wise.
I do not know that person.
Greetings.

You seek the leafy glade? Once there was a way from this Realm, but it has been lost. Alas, I would visit it myself if I could. They say the plants are alive, and a race of cat people live amongst the trees, in the green shade where the sun never reaches below the endless canopy.
You would know of the next Realm? I have heard that an undying prince rules over the ruins of a dead city where the sun never rises.
I do not know that person.
I am she.

My mother came from there. She told me tales of white elven castles sleeping in shady forest glades, of the undying patient wait of my folk. She chose another path, but did not manage to travel further than this Realm.
I do not know that person.
The city in the wastelands has fallen.
He is the blacksmith in the village, an honest enough fellow.
I have none for you.
The blessings of The Mistress of the Rains are sought by many. Praised be her name, Beiweh of the shining face, may she bring growth and health on all creatures.
The city of the gnomes is to the south.
Farewell.
The white goddess. She is the patron of the leonals and their Order.
I avoid the city...
Both the village and the castle bear the name.
No doubt you mean the Great Gate, portal to the Third Realm? It lies beyond the wastelands. It is a perilous path that you seek to tread.
He is the god of war and blood, heedless of anything else.
I care not.
Bah. They'll get their comeuppance some day. Hope I'm there to see it.
I care not.
The guildmaster is down the corridor...
Never heard of him.
Never heard of him.

Hpmf. Go find some housewives to chat with. 

Heh heh. On second thoughts, I reckon a gnomish lass might be more than you can handle.
I am Mentes.
Never heard of him.
What do you need?
I have no dealings with the merchants in Ichiba.
From what?
Heh heh heh. No thanks, you're not my type.
Hrmpf. <makes a warding hand sign>
Hrpf. <spits noisily on the ground>
Never heard of him.
Never heard of him.
Never heard of him.
Little point going there, now that the way to Hail is closed.
Never heard of him.
You noticed? Hrpfh. Yes, this is the city of the gnomes. No haughty lion folk here. Watch your step and you'll be fine. And don't drink the sundew, you don't look feisty enough.
Hmpf. Indeed.

Some would tell you that the dog people are craftier woodsmen than us. I say - those who say so have no woodcraft themselves and cannot know! Bah, I could smell a gnoll in the woods from a hundred meters away.
Never heard of her.
I have hear those who trade with Ichiba mention his name.
I seldom go there these days.
My pleasure.
I care not.
Never heard of him.
I am he.
I don't know.
Mnesus the Mighty. The only thing he's better at than fighting is drinking, and the only thing he's better at than drinking is swiving.
Never heard of him.
Greetings.
I don't know.
I care not.
He is above.
Never heard of her.
So you're from there are you? Hrphf. Thought you looked foreign.
Never heard of him.
You mean the relief on the throne room doors? Hmpf. Outsiders often find it disturbing. Mnesus enjoys the effect. I suggest you think nothing of it.
I have not been there. Hmpf. Especially since the dragon sacked it.
Never heard of him.
Hmpf. You have come to the wrong place.
I care not.
It is a fine city, is it not?
Farewell.
I care not.
Ichiba is a lawless place. What do you expect?
Bah. I have not been there.
It is far from here.
I care not.
Do not trust the trickster god of the road.
We are the children of The Lady, her chosen. The White Order has brought law and order to some small portion of this Realm, so that cities such as this may prosper.
The horror of the Maze will drive you insane if you think too deeply on it.
I do not know him?
The quartermaster at Danaos is a friend of mine.
He is the gnoll chieftain, they have a village near here.
Though they deny it, I have heard that the C.O.C. are concerned about the impact of crime on trade in Ichiba.
I am Diomedes, Lieutenant of the White Order, emmisary to Ichiba. I am chief Priest of this temple, a missionary spreading the word of The Lady.
A rumour, nothing more.
There are merchants near the town center.

Not much happens here that isn't sanctioned by the C.O.C.

Obey their laws and they will treat you well.
My loyalty to the Order is paramount.
Uncouth scum.
A dry desert god, a god of fire and unlife.
Our great general, master of the White Order and high priest of The Lady.
A shadowy figure. I do not know him.
Yes, the gnome spy here in Ichiba. He runs some sort of brick-a-brac store down an alley somewhere. I have caught him sneaking outside my temple on occasion, but he has never dared more than that.
The gnoll tinker? He is not the sharpest arrow in the quiver.
The wastes, others call them the wilds. There is a large area of this Realm that is uninhabitted save for wild beasts and monsters.
I do not know him.
Do not trust the gnomes. Their stature is small but their magick is large and their wickedness knows no bounds.
Stenelaus is the door warden of Danaos Castle. A good soldier. Give him my regards should you meet him.

Yes, congratulations on your escape to this Realm. You will find less civilisation that you are used to, i fear. Other than Ichiba here and Danaos to the north, there is little other than deadly wastes and the trickery of the gnomes.
The gnolls have a village near here. They are a fierce and proud people, and few in this Realm can match their woodcraft.
The witch in the tower? She speaks sweetly, but at best she is untrustworthy. At worst... who knows what dark magicks she works in her lair?
The Director of the C.O.C. He is man of small spirit, a bean counter of the worst sort.
Ichiba. For all it's squalor and evil, this town has immense promise and energy. I could almost enjoy it here, if it wasn't for the smell.
My pleasure.
She of the whirlwind and the wing, faster than a ray of sunshine.
I am he. Missionary and diplomat representing the White Order in this town.
I do not know him.
I do not know of it.
The king of the gnomes. Deep in his lair in Aenen he broods, hatching plans of mischief and deceptions to harry us.
The inn keeper across town? Yes, I know him. Occasionally I stop at his establishment for a draught. He is the servant of the Chamber of Commerce though, do not forget that in your dealing with him.
Greetings, adventurers.
I have not heard of it.
Legends of the Third Realm are few. The Gate is reached through the wastes, few pass that way since the fall of Hail. Of the Realm itself, I can tell little that is not mere heresay.
I do not know of him.
I do not know of her.
Some time you must tell me of your home. Is my lady The Lady worshipped there too?
I do not know him.
Hail was once a great city, but it has fallen. One used to be able to reach it from Danaos, but the way is closed now.
I do not know him.
The Order may have use for you. You should travel north, to Danaos.
May she bring us rain and sun, life and laughter, growth and health.
Aenen is the largest gnome settlement, south of here.
Farewell.

Our goddess, The Lady of the spear and shield. To the faithful she is merciful and just. 
She is the patron of the White Order, who guard the borders north of here at Danaos castle. By her grace we hold back the darkness from these civilised lands.
Some elements of society tend always towards crime. I do not associate with them.

Danaos, the white castle, home of my order. Have you seen it?
Mighty towers rising above the forest, grim battlements glittering with the helms of my folk. Smoke rising from the forges and ovens, the clatter of arms and the marching footsteps of the faithful going early and eager about their business! O how I long to return!
The Gate to the Third Realm is somewhere in the wastelands. Belisarius, the general of my Order, would know more.
Do not trifle with the fearsome god of war.
I am not religious.
We Leonals are the only hope the Second Realm has. It's only a matter of time before Ichiba falls, and the gnomes would rather dig down than fight back.
The Maze can be beaten, and we Leonals will be the ones to do it!
Don't know him.
Don't know him.
Don't know him.
I'm on duty here.
I am Stenelaus, Door Warden of the castle.
Faerie tales.
Ha! Try Stentor the smith in town.
They run things in Ichiba. Merchants, not warriors.
This is a castle, not a prison.
Your words will never harm me.
I am not religious.
The General is the greatest Leonal I know. His name will be writ large when the histories of these times are compiled.
Don't know him.
Don't know him.
Don't know him.
Beyond Danaos there lies no further civilisation. The wastes are teeming with foes. Best be prepared if you are venturing there.
Don't know him.
The gnomes continue to harass our efforts to secure the civilised Domains from the wilds. They are a godless bunch, stubborn and disrespectful.
Yes, that is I.
I am impressed that you managed to make it here from the First Realm. You must be tougher than you look. Ha!
Scum.
I have heard that the enchantress of Ichiba consorts with gnoll warriors that she bewitches in the forest and draws back to her tower. Disgusting.
Don't know him.
The Gate to Ichiba Domain is to the east.
A pleasure.
I'm not religious.
I know of Diomedes who runs the temple in Ichiba. He is a steadfast and honourable soldier. If you see him pass on my regards.
Do';t know him.
Ha! Go tell your faerie tales to the druids.
He is king of the gnomes. I hear he is a drunkard and a womaniser.
Don't know him.
Greetings, strangers.
Never heard of it.
Perhaps one day I will see it for myself.
Don't know him.
She was banished from Danaos for practising witchcraft.
You are from the First Realm? Remarkable, few make it through the Great Gate.
Don't know him.
That city fell to the Maze years ago.
His smithy is in town. Good quality weapons and armour. A good smith, despite the mild disgrace attached to one who grew too old for active service rather than dying gloriously.
If your quest involved business within the castle, I would know about it.
I'm not religious.
That's the hole that the gnomes call home.
Farewell strangers. The castle is open only to those with business here.
The Lady protect us.
There are indeed thieves in Ichiba. What else would you expect from a city run by merchants?
You are here.
The Gate back to Ichiba lies to the east of the village.
I'm not religious.
I cannae advise ye much on matters of the spirit.
Bah, the lion people and their order are a plague on this Realm!
Aye, the maze. What can be said that has not been said before? Best to get on with yer business.
Aye, at yer service.
I ken him not.
I ken him not.

Well now. I've heard a rumour that the witch in Ichiba City and the dog people have some sort of dealings with eachother. Har har, though I dinae ken what each side gets from the other, I can imagine a few things! Har har har!
Ye can call me Sarpedon, thank ye very much.
I havnae time fer fairy tales.
Nar, get yerselves over to Mentes' place.
I've heard o' them, the merchants in Ichiba. Thieving rogues, they say.
Aye, we all must dream.
Har har har. Fuck yerselves too!
I cannae advise ye much on matters of the spirit.
Och, the leader of the leonals. He's not to be trifled with.
I ken him not.
Aye, he is in Ichiba, I think.
I ken him not.
Well now. There be dragons. Har har har!
I ken him not.
What will ye hear me say of us gnomes? Here we are, here we have been, here we shall remain whether ye or anyone else like it or not. Yar, we will be here after ye all have gone to dust or moved on.
This Realm, it isnae so bad, if ye stick to the safer areas. That means here in the Crater.
The dog people? Keen noses and a bad temper.
I ken her not.
I ken him not.

A den of scum and villainy, if yer asking me. Everything ye think of for sale, at a price. Merchants and small spirited people in charge. And a crazy witch brewing who can say what magicks in a tower. Aye, give me the tunnels of Aenen any day thank you very much!
Wasnae problem.
I cannae advise ye much on matters of the spirit.
I ken him not.
Aye, he runs a shop near here.
I cannae say.
Mnesus the Might, King of All Gnomes. A good leader to our folk he is, aye.
I ken him not.
Arrr.
I cannae say.
I dinnae have time for fairy tales.
He is above ground.
I ken her not.
I havenae met many from there. There was a man came through here not long ago... Dorian? Do ye know him? Hi didnae stay long before moving on.
I ken him not.

Aye, the throne room doors. It is a cunning work.

We gnomes believe that all is a machine, even the living. One day, maybe, we will unravel all of it's secrets.
The city in the wastes? Aye, it fell long ago.
I ken him not.
Har har.
I cannae advise ye much on matters of the spirit.
Aye, this is the city of the gnomes. Our ancenstors carved it out of the natural caverns many generations ago.
Goodbye.
I cannae advise ye much on matters of the spirit.
I cannae say.
The castle of the White Order, northwards from here. Are ye heading that-a-way? Ye'd best not anger the lions! Har har har.
Aye, there be a Gate, into the Third Realm. But it is far from here, amidst the wastelands. A perilous journey to reach it...
I cannae advise ye much on matters of the spirit.
Hrrrr, a shifty god.
The White Order, a potent forrce forr good in this Realm.
Hrrmmm. The maze sees all.
I know him not.
At yourrrrr service, rrrrr.
Mmmm, I know him not.
I am prrroud to have been a memberrrr of the White Orderrrr for all of my life.
Hrrmmm. The maze knows all.
You may purchase suppliess frrrom me.
Hrrrrmmm, yes. The traderrrs from Ichiba. They drive harrrrd bargains.
Grrrr. The maze does not permit escape, better to enjoy what frrrreedoms one has here.
Grrrrr.
Grrrrr. Speak not his name.
Ourrr nobel leader, a legend in hiss own time!
I know him not.
Hrrrr, Diomedes has spoken of him as untrustworthy.
I know him not.
Hrmmmm. Danoas is the end of the civilised lands. Beyond lie the wilds, deadly to the unprepared traveller.
Mmmm, I know him not.
Grrrrrr. Hrmph. The little folk, always working their darrrk magic beneath the ground.
I know him not.
The second Rrrrealm was a wild place beforre we brrrought order.
Grrrmmmm. Savages. But worrthy warrriors, noblerrrr than the gnomes.
I have heard of the green sorcerrrress of Ichiba. Little that I have hearrd is good.
Grrmm, the directorrrr of the Ichiba Chamber Of Commerce. A man a rrreal power in the town.
Perrhaps our Realms most prrrosperous city, but dirrty and full of thieves, beggarrs and cold hearted merrrchants.
My pleasurrrrre.
Rrrr, the messenger goddess, swift of foot.
He is ourr representative in Ichiba, a good soldier.
Hmm, I know him not.
I do not know.
Brrrrmm, chieftain of the gnomes. I have heard he has a dozen demons bound by dark sorrrcerry to do his bidding.
The drrruidess Lorelei was banished a year ago for practising her earthly magic in ourrrr town.
I know him not.
Grrrrrreetings.
I have not heard of it.
I have hearrrrd tales of black horses underrr a sunless sky. None come back this way.
I know him not.
She is banished from our lands.
Where you arrrre from, yes? I have met few others in my lifetime.
I know him not.
That city has fallen, darkness has engulfed the wilder half of this Rrrrealm.
A good soldierrr.
Betterrrr make sure you arrre properly equipped.
Hrmmmm, I do not know much of the spring goddess.
Hrrrrr, it is the gloomy lairr of the gnomes, deep underground where they work theirr dark magicks.
Au~revoirrrrrr.
Patrrron of our White Order.
There arrrre always those who cannot live within the law.
Ourrr mighty castle, home of the White Order. A bastion of defence forrrr the civilised parts of this Realm.
Gates arrre not my business.
The warrr god, not to be trrrifled with.
He is the god of the road.
The lion folk live in their castle, to the north.
We are all victims. We are all survivors.
I cannot say.
I cannot say.
He is the chief.
Red Ear says that there are new taxes levied in Ichiba every day.

I and Three Eyes Shaman. The gnoll people are my folk.

You look different to my spirit sight. A doom of some kind hangs over you.
I cannot say.
You may have better luck in the city.
They like to think that they rule in Ichiba.
Destiny is a strange thing.
Hmmmm. Behave yourselves, cubs.
He is the god of the underworld. May his eye pass over us and continue on its way.
I have heard the name of the chief of the leonals.
He may be in Ichiba, but he is hard to keep track of.
He is in Ichiba.
He is in Ichiba.

We gnolls do not leave the forest.

Legends tell of the icy demon Ineoth, dwelling under the leaves of a dark forest, who takes the shape of a gnoll. I do not know if these are true.
A name of myth, steeped with evil.
The gnome folk live under the earth, southwards from here.
Yes, we are here.
We are what we are. Are you more free than us?
She is in Ichiba, for now.
He is in Ichiba, counting his money.
The city nearby. You smell of it.
It was nothing.
She is the messenger of the gods.
He is in Ichiba.
I cannot say.
I have heard of the lands of the fey.
I have heard of the chief of the gnomes, on his throne beneath the earth.
He is in Ichiba.
Greetings.
It is a mythical forest world.
I cannot say.
I cannot say.
I cannot say.
I cannot say.
I am he.
I cannot say.
I cannot say.
I cannot say.
Blessed be her name, the lady of the harvest.
The gnomes build below ground, for safety I believe.
Good hunting.
She is the goddess of the leonals.
Ichiba attracts many types, some good, some bad.
The lion folk have built a mighty castle.
I cannot say.
He is the god of war.
An ambivalent god. But then, aren't they all? Heh. *yghh*
The leonals and their Order continue to harass us. *ykgh*. There is enmity and mistrust... but few open hostilties yet.
Heh. What can one say of the Maze? He he he. After all, it is listening...
He was in Aenen, last I heard.
I an unaware.
Eh? The gnoll chieftain is a cunning leader.
Hmmm. Silence is golden, I always say! he he he
I am Glaucus. How can I be of service?
I an unaware.
Heh heh heh. Yes, I will trade with you. What do you need? *yhgk* *yhgk*
Ah, heh. The Chamber of Commerce, down the road from here is their offices. The big building. They regulate trade here. *yhhg*. The tariffs are not low.
Of course, who does not think of freedom? *yghk*. Count your blessings today I say, let tomorrow look after itself.
He he he! *yghh!* <spits noisily on the floor>
*yhgg* Fate keep the death god far from us.
*Yghhh*. Belisarius, General of the White Order, lord of the leonals. He is in Danaos. He he he, I hear he does like gnomes much.
I have heard that he is some sort of chief brigand amongst the local thieves? He he he he.
*yghh*. At your service!
Heh he he. His shop is at the water front.
Ah *yghh*. Beyond the civilised parts of the Realm are the wastes. Now that Hail has fallen, few pass that way.
I an unaware.

We gnomes where here in the Second Realm before any others. *yghh* I know not how we came here. *hgyh* In the mists of time it was us against what beasts the maze chose to throw against us. More lately, the haughty leonals harass us. *ghgh!* Our kingdom is small, but we endure.
Welcome again to this Realm, friends. *yghy* Hope you're not too disappointed, he he he
Ah, the gnolls. They have a village near here. Broken Fang is the chieftain.
*yghk*. The Sorceress in the Tower? I don't trust her. Nothing personal, I just mistrust mysterious mages in towers. he he he.
The Director of the C.O.C. is seldom away from his desk. *kygh*. He pays mercenaries to run the city. Yet, something has always troubled me, though I cannot put my finger on it.
*yhhg* Ichiba, the City in the Crater. The hub of trade in this Realm. My current home. *hygk* Sometimes, a challenging place to abide. But one makes the best of it.
The pleasure is mine! He he heh
*yghh* The messenger goddess.
That leonal abides in the temple of The Lady. He hee heh. No doubt he will be enthusiastic to tell you of his goddess. *yhhgg*
I an unaware.
I an unaware.
Mnesus the Mighty *yhgh* King of All Gnomes. His throne is in Aenen. A worthy leader, wise and forbearing.
*yghh*. His ale is not bad.
Greetings!
I an unaware.
I know little more than rumours about the next Realm.
I an unaware.
I an unaware.
*hykg*. I have heard there are many people there. Is it crowded? He he he. Here we have fewer, I wager. But the wastelands are full of uncivilised beasts of all descriptions...
I have heard that is the name of the witch doctor in the gnoll village.
Och. The city of Hail has fallen to the forces of darkness. *yghy*. A sad day. It was in the midst of what is now the called the wastelands.
I an unaware.
He he he. Is the Maze not dangerous enough already? *yghy* Adventure? You could visit Aenen and see what you find...
Her blessing on us.
Ah, my home Aenen, *ygh* deep beneath the green earth. It is far south of here. You should visit it. Our king Mnesus the Mighty is there.
*ygkh*, farewell.
The iron goddess, followed by the leonals. They claim to be her chosen people.
Heh heh heh. Ichiba is a melting pot. Some good, some bad.
North of here is the way to Danaos, the castle of the White Order.
Heh, I thought you might ask. *hgyh* All I know is that the next Great Gate lies somewhere beyond the city of Hail.
The war god, not known for his subtlety. *yghk*
Emmons, called by some The Hand. On account of my skill with dice, yes indeed.
Emmons watched his own back, thank ye kindly.
They like fighting. And praying. Emmons tries to have business elsewhere from those two activities.
Fiddlesticks to yer Maze. As Emmons always says, the time is now for living.
One of them gnomes.
Agenor, the one who manages the lion's share of supplies, heh, heh.
Indeed, Broken Fang rules the gnolls.

Emmons heard a rumour that yer wallet was empty!

Heh heh heh, just messing with ye!
Aye some call Emmons 'The Hand'. Due to the firm grip of me greeting, ye understand.
Aye, and I'm a Juggling Master. Heh.
What do ye have to offer, and what do ye seek in return?

Aye, I've little time for suits and ties meself.

But as Emmons always says, hate ye the game and nary the players!
All the action is here. Only trouble lies on the road ye seek!
Well, aren't ye a bundle of joy.
Ye'll meet him one day, mateys, as will we all.
The great tactician of the Leonals. Less good at logistics though, heh.
Ah yes, a business partner and friend of Emmons. We go way back, ye ken.
The gnome with a knack for concoctions. Stinks though.
Eh, sorry, mateys. That's a blank slate for Emmons.
Stick to the city mateys, much better for business.
Eh, sorry, mateys. That's a blank slate for Emmons.
Thinkers and builders. Emmons knows they like niece things in their homes...
One of them leonals.
And the only Realm that matters to Emmons!
Tooth and claw reign supreme in the tribes. Broken Fang is their leader.
Reckoning will come for that frigid harlot some day. Sooner rather than later! Mark ye Emmon's words.
A stiff suite and little else.

It's the only place to be in the Second Realm. Ye can find folks of all sorts from gnomes to leonals there.

Emmons has various going concerns in the city, and good business it is indeed.
A pleasure!
What brings her into our conversation? Got a message or just a fancy for divine tales?

Eh, the noble paladin is indeed without fault. 

Also without a few candlesticks last time Emmons checked, heh heh.

Emmons has heard he sells weapons in Aenen.
Emmons has never been to his store. Honest.
Eh, sorry, mateys. That's a blank slate for Emmons.
Heh heh. King of the gnomes. Rich. His harem upkeep alone makes Emmons eyes water!
Eh yes, he runs a fine establishment indeed!
Emmons has but little time for chit chat...
Eh, sorry, mateys. That's a blank slate for Emmons.
Emmons knows nothing, and doesn't care neither!
Asius, the gnome in Aenen with the knack for trade. Emmons doesn't mind 'im.
Eh, sorry, mateys. That's a blank slate for Emmons.
Eh, sorry, mateys. That's a blank slate for Emmons.
One of them gnolls.
Was a time there was a lot going on there. Emmons has some good times he did. Not more now, nor never again methinks.
One of them leonals.
Aye, Emmons is always on a quest. A quest for action! Heh heh!
A name tied to the cycles of life.
Aye, a place of secrets and gears. What's your interest in the tunnels beneath the surface?
Back to business.
The White Lady. Her priests like the colour of gold too though, heh heh.
Careful what ye ask, sometimes it's better not to know.

What's yer interest in the lion's den then?

Not many ways in, though Emmons knows of one extra way out, yes indeed...

Gates, yeah there be Gates. Minor Gates between the Domains of the Second Realm - Ichiba, Danaos, Aenen, Hail, all of them.

Of course Emmons knows ye're looking for the Great Gate, the Gate to the Third Realm. Cannae help ye there, alas.
Aye the god of war, Emmons couldn't care.
May he bless us with luck.
The high and mighty lion folk, always marching this way and that, building fortifications, planning wars.
Honestly, I'm pretty comfortable where I am.
Nope, dunno.
Nope, dunno.
He's the big chief gnoll, lord of their little village near here. Heh.
I've heard that drinking beer make you forget your troubles! Har har har.
I am Scrymgeour, inn keeper and brewer.

Heh. You adventurers are all the same. Stories of shadowy forces, watching your every move, secret conspiracies of vast forces moving mysteriously against you? Har har har! Have another beer and tell me more about it!
I've got some new stuff, have a look.
The C.O.C. keeps the city working. Law and order, regulated trade, standards and accountability. It would be chaos here without Pickett and his men.
I hear it's to be found in the bottom of a beer mug. Har har.
Beer is a little strong for you, I see. How about an orange juice?

<make a hand sign of protection against evil>

May he turn his gaze elsewhere!
He's the Leonal General, probably at their castle Danaos.
Bah, he's the worst of the brigands. There's a bag of gold on his head, if you see him.
The gnome tinker? Calls himself a diplomat, but I'm not sure he knows what the word means! Har har har.
Damn dirty dog, trying to set up shop in town. He's got no idea about income tax, levies, rental. Raises a stink every month when he's due to the Chamber. Don't know why they still put up with it.
Ah yes. Most of this Realm is a waste. Rather stay here in Ichiba.
Nope, dunno.
Little mischief makers, not to be trusted. Good customers though - like their spirits, and tend to fall asleep under the table rather than starting a fight later on.

Most of it is a waste, monsters and beasts and such. Then there's the leonals and the gnomes, always bickering with eachother. And the damn dog soldiers, sneaking around in the forest. We've got a good thing going in Ichiba, stick around here and you'll be ok.

Them dogs are savages, dirty rascals with no morals. These days I try keep them out of the place, all they do is get drunk and start fights. Nasty fights too. Bah, they should stay in the damn forest.

Take that Red Ear, the junk seller across the road! Why the Chamber let's him ply his trade and sell his useless rubbish in town, I don't know.

<makes a hand sign of protection against evil> 

Gods protect us from whatever dark forces that witch is toying with in ther tower! The Chamber should run her out of town, I always say. There's no place for sorcery in an organised town.
A good man, fair and honest. Runs the C.O.C. like a tight ship, got his finger on the pulse. This city would fall apart without him.

A smallish town, but a good one. Lots of trade, lots of buzz. The pace here is quicker than many folk like, but myself, I love it. Love my job. Not bad for a prison, this part of the Maze. Har har har.
My pleasure.
May she bring us luck.
The lion in the Temple? Har har har. Comes here for a beer now and then, tries to convert us all to his faith.
Nope, dunno.
Nope, dunno.
He's the big old King Gnome. I hear he has a dozen wives, there in his undergound harem, and all of them busy brewing beer for him! Har har har.
Yep, that's me, your humble servant!
What can I do for you?
Nope, dunno.

I hear all kinds of tales. Giants the size of mountains. Black nights on blazing steeds. Carniverous rabbits the size of horses, with glowing red eyes! Swarms of tiny machines, each hungry for blood!

Har har har. Have another beer and let's talk about it.
Nope, dunno.
Nope, dunno.
Well done on escaping! Back home, you'd be a legend. Here, you're just another unemployment statistic. Har har har. How about a beer?
The witchdoctor of the gnolls? Why d'ye ask - looking for a love potion? Or, something to cure your boils or make your hair grow back? Har har har.
Aye, the city in the wastelands. It has fallen now. The makes the Adventurers Arms the best pub in the Realm!
Nope, dunno.
Har har har. Here's your quest: have another beer!
Her blessings on our produce. Especially my beer. Har har har.
Yep, the gnomish city? It's to the south, and under the ground.
Bye.
May she bless and protect us.
Damn bandits. The C.O.C. keep hiring mercenaries, but the blasted brigands keep harassing us.
It's a big castle, with a small village. North of here. You'd better be on good terms with the leonals if you head up that way.
There's a Gate to the next Realm, somewhere. You'd do better to ask someone other than me though.
May his blessing give us strength.
I don't really have time for that sort of thing.

The lion folk, always stalking around in the clanking armour. Most of them are pious and honest to a fault, thanks to that humourless goddess they worship. Running caravans out to their castle Danaos is a bit tedious - they have little grasp of the the niceties of modern economics. I once spent hours explaining compound interest to their quartermaster... and a month later he flew into a rage when I sent him a bill!
Yes, we are all stuck in the Maze, aren't we.
Don't know him.
Don't know him.
He's the chief of the gnoll village. An ignorant brute.
I've heard that damn witch Imogen isn't as young as she looks, if you know what I mean.
I'm W E Pickett, Director of the Ichiba Chamber of Commerce. It's a thankless job, but I bear the burden willingly.
I don't really have time for that sort of thing.
Yes, that's what I do. Not your sort though, why don't you see what Scrymgeour in town can do for you?

Trade is the lifeblood of Ichiba, and we control the trade. Everyone gets a fair deal, we take our cut, and provide logistical and security related services. Bottom line - goods keep moving. Can't have it any other way.
I'm more interested in profit and loss, myself. To each his own.
That's really not necessary.
I don't really have time for that sort of thing.
The leonal boss. A good soldier, I'm sure. But his grasp of economics is lacking. We're not living in the dark ages any more, children are taught about compound interest in school these days.

He's blackguard of the worst sort - a rogue without morals or conscience, as lazy and shifty as they come. The local riff raff look up to him as some kind of leader, and he of course plays along and styles himself the Bandit King. Bah! The sooner we clean them up the better.
The little gnome tinker has a shop in town. He claims he is supposed to be some kind of embassy from the gnomes to Ichiba. If you ask me, he's just a smooth talking con man.
That's the gnoll who opened a shop in town recently. He's having some trouble with basic concepts like rent, tax and trading licenses. Damn savage gnolls, they should just stay in the forest.
Beyond the Crater lie the wastelands. No civilisation these days, though we used to run caravans out to Hail City, before it fell.
Don't know him.

We run caravans out to the little folk, in their city Aenen. They're a reasonable trading partner, but their record keeping is horrendous. Best not to let them get into debt, because tomorrow morning they'll have woken up and forgotten about it!
There's little civilisation here, just what you see in the Crater. Not much of a market. But, people need goods, and the caravans must run.
Those savage dog people would be more of a problem, if they weren't so stupid. As it is, the expenditure to distract them from our caravans is minimal.

Indeed I do know the green sorceress. Frankly, she's a nuisance. Always throwing her weight around, expecting special treatment, looking after her own ends. Having a witch working who-knows-what magicks in a lonely tower would be trying enough if she kept to herself, but it's insufferable when she tries to get involved in matters of economy and politics.
Yes, that's me. Director of the Ichiba Chamber of Commerce.

Ichiba might be smallish, by the scale of cities in the First Realm. But it's the best we have in thie Realm. And it's not such a bad place - there's an appetite for trade in this Crater, and with the C.O.C. providing a helping hand the economy is thriving.
Not a problem.
I don't really have time for that sort of thing.
He's the leonal at the temple. Pretty typical of his sort - proud, stiff-upper-lip, all about prayers and soldiering.
Don't know him.
I don't really have time for that sort of thing.
He's the boss of the gnomes, down south in Aenen.
A good man. Runs the inn near the waterfront - he's your guy if you want a drink or a bed for the night.
Hello.
I don't really have time for that sort of thing.
I'd run a caravan there, if there was profit in it. But there isn't.
Don't know him.
Don't know her.

Well, I know the trade network we have here can't compare to what you're used to at home. But circumstances are different. This Realm is a lot wilder, a lot less of a civilised market to sell into. But we're doing what we can. It takes time to build up.
I think that's the name of the so called shaman of the gnolls.

We used to run caravans out to Hail, before my time in this position. But the city was sacked by a dragon. Bad for business, that. We don't send people out that way now. It's a pity, I was fond of the cider they made there.
Don't know him.
Not right now.
I don't really have time for that sort of thing.
Yes, where the gnomes live. We run some caravans out that way.
Goodbye.
I don't really have time for that sort of thing.

Those blasted thieves are an incessant nuisance! They're led by a fellow called Kay, who styles himself as some sort of glorified brigand king. Needless to say, their banditry comes straight off our bottom line. They have no regard for the hard work an honest merchant puts into making a living!
An expensive construction project, that castle.
The Great Gate? Oh, I'm sure it's around somewhere. Try looking in the furthest, most dangerous part of the Realm that you can find. Ha ha ha.
I don't really have time for that sort of thing.
A fickle god to follow.
Here we are, holding back the forces of chaos and darkness from this Realm. The children of The Lady are few but we are mighty and our sword arms are rightly feared.
I do not know the why's and wherefore's, my business is survival.
He is some kind of general amongst the gnomes.
The quartermaster.
I do not know of him.
I work with plans not rumours.

I am General of the White Order and High Priest of The Lady. On my shoulders fall the responsibility for keeping the flame of law and order burning in this Realm. I burdensome task, and one that will some day lead to my death. But I am proud to bear it.
A figure of legend.
Go and see the quartermaster.
The merchants in Ichiba thrive while our swords and shields keep back the wilds.
Hrrrmmmmm. Who does not dream of freedom?
Watch your tongue kittens.
All fear the death god.
Yes, that is my name.
It is said he rules the thieves in Ichiba.
A gnome spy.
I have heard of this gnoll, but nothing important.
Dangerous Domains. Hail used to be an outpost of civilisation, but now that too is gone.
I know nothing of dark magic.
The gnomes continue to harass our efforts to bring Order to this Realm.

The Second Realm has two sides. Here we hold back the wilds and order of sorts prevails as far as Aenen. Beyond, now that the city of Hail has fallen there is little but beasts and danger. The ungoverned Domains are beset with monsters of all descriptions and haunted by seven deadly spirits set to guard the Gate within.
The gnolls are prrrimitive, but one must not underestimate their wood craft or warrior spirit.
The witch who lives in Ichiba? She and her pet gnolls tend to mind their own business.
The de facto king of Ichiba, ruling with tariffs and mercenaries.
Hub of the Realm. Your sort generally fit in well there.
A pleasure. Hrmmmm.
An ambivalent goddess to follow.
He is filling the post with distinction.
I do not know him.
I seek to know nothing of the fey.
The gnomish king. A worthy adversary. I do not know what he seeks within this Realm.
I do not know him.
Hrmmmm. Yes?
I know nothing of earth magic.
Legends tell of a Realm ruled by a temple of deathless knights, riding demon horses amidst the ruins and wastes of a once mighty kingdom.
I do not know of him.
The druidess of some sort, caught stirring up trouble a while back.
Is it true that there have been no wars there in living memory? Hrmmmm. It must be a land of plenty indeed.
I have not heard of him.
Once a bustling trading city, Hail has fallen to the forces of chaos. They say a dragon of some sort now lords over the ruins.
He is without.
Yes, adventurers call them quests.
The goddess of fertility and growth. Her followers mean well.
The underground city of the gnomes. As well defended as our castle, and for the same reasons.
Goodbye.
The Lady, the iron goddess of justice and mercy. Patron of the White Order. She watches over the just and the downtrodden, soldiers and priests and peasants.
Thieves are probably to be found in Ichiba. Hrmmmrmmm.
Hrmmm. Our Castle. The mightiest fortification in the Realm, I dare say.
We all seek gates. The Gate to the Third Realm lies deep within the wastes.
The war god is not to be taken lightly.
I have little time for religion.
Yes, the Leonals. Hostilities preclude much trade with them. A pity.
The ways of the Maze are beyond my ken, I am a humble merchant seeking to make the best of this world we are in.
The guildmaster's barracks are nearby here. They are regular customers!
Never heard of him.
I do not know him.
I know of no such thing.
My name is Pandarus, renowned as a tobacconist and gentlegnome throughout the Realm.
I have little time for big tales.
Yes, you have come to right place. I stock the widest variety of tobacco and the related accoutrements and utilities in the Second Realm.

They run trade in Ichiba. Heartless, thieving soundrels they are. Exorbitant taxes, truly exorbitant! On both imports and exports! An ineffective at preventing crime and corruption, despite their monopoly. Alas, one must deal with them as one best can.
Some dream of escape in the future. I dream of profit in the present.
Mind your language children.
I have little time for religion.
I hear he is a wanted criminal in Ichiba.
I have heard that the Leonal General is most discerning in his choice of pipe weed.
Yes, he is in Ichiba. I organise my caravans through him, his rates are very reasonable.
I have met the gnoll merchant in Ichiba. He's not the sharpest arrow in the quiver, so to speak.
Beyond Aenen and Danaos the lands of the Realm are increasingly risky. Since the fall of Hail I have had no cause to run caravans through them.
I have little time for big tales.

The craft of the gnomes is unsurpassed. Particularly in the art of tobacco. Have you tried Aenen Cavegrown? Mine is the freshest that you will find, direct from the caverns where it is cultivated and hand picked so that the best leaves are sold domestically.
Many complain, but where others see the dangers of the Second Realm I see opportunity.
The gnolls are too savage to appreciate good tobacco. They smoke all manner of heathen herbs, whatever fragant plant they can burn.
That is the name of the witch in Ichiba. I know little of her.
He runs the Chamber of Commerce in Ichiba. A small minded man, a soulless bean counter. I hope he chokes on his next cigar!
The city of Ichiba is the busiest in the Realm. A stinking hole, but a lucrative market. I export much tobacco there.
The pleasure is all mine.
I have little time for religion.
I do not know him.
A good fellow. His smithy is nearby.
I have little time for big tales.
Our glorious king. I have nothing ill to say, his policies are wise and his taste in tobacco is impeccable.
I have been to his tavern in Ichiba, the beer was quite palatable.
Greetings, how may I help you?
I know nothing of that.
I would give much to a caravan that could go there and return. It is not believed to be possible, but sometimes I wonder...
Yes, he trades outside the Gate. Risky, risky but lucrative. You will of course find fare superior wares here within Ichiba.
I do not know her.
I have heard that the First Realm is much larger than the Second. More populous, more cities, more trade. A caravan that could make the journey, and return, would reap great reward!
I do not know him.
Hail fell years ago. A pity, there was good trade to be had with that outpost. A risky route, but such brings great reward.
I believe that is the name of a Leonal smith in Danaos.
I know of no such things.
I have little time for religion.
Yes, tobacco, called pipe weed by the vulgar. A fine herb, a speciality of mine. You will not find better for sale anywhere in the Realm.

Aenen, the greatest city in the Second Realm. The products of our craftsmen and machinists are sought after throughout the lands. Our defenses are second to none. If I sound prideful, it is merely because I speak the truth.
Farewell, come again soon!
I have little time for religion.
That is the castle of the Leonals. I have not been there.
I have no doubt that your journey to the Gate will be long and ardous. Why not stock a little tobacco? It greatly refreshes and restores the weary traveller.
I have little time for religion.
Bahhhhr. Grrrrr. Laws and soldiers and papers! Red Ear is an honest trader! Why must he be harassed and robbed by these? Brrrrrhrmm!
Red Ear does not know.
Grrr, sneering lion-folk. Always all swords, shiny armour. Too good to talk to red Ear. Their place northwards, Danaos big white castle.
Yarrr, we all in the Maze. What to do? Red Ear does deals.
Red Ear does deals not quests.
Red Ear does not know him.
Red Ear does not know him.
He is the nobel chieftain of Gnoll-kind. Red Ear is his humble servant.
Red Ear has the best deals!
Red Ear does not know him.
Yes, yes! Red Ear always has the best deals in Ichiba!
Red Ear is happy here, food and warmth and trading in safe Ichiba.
Grrrrrr, filthy dholes.
Red Ear does not know.
Hrmmmm. Great general of the lion warriors, far away in the white castle.
Bah, beggar and criminal. Red Ear wishes him an early end. Complains to the soldiers and law people, they too useless to catch him.
Grrrmm, shifty gnome wizard. His deals not as good as Red Ear.
Red Ear has the best deals!
Red Ear does not know him.
Grrr, shifty gnome folk wizards, always whispering to each other, never doing good deals. Their lair-hole far south of here - Aenen village.
Yarr, we all in the Second Realm. Ichiba biggest city. Red Ear best deals in Ichiba. Second Realm. Yarr.
Yarmmmm. Grrrrr. Further in Second Realm, wastelands. Red Ear not go there. Dangerous and far.

Gnoll-folk are mighty in the Realm! War Chief Broken Fang commands a hundred spears, fights with the strength of bear! Gnoll warriors go unseen by anyone through the trees, see and hear all! Famous wizard shaman Three Eyes guides the tribe by his wisdom. Mighty are the Gnoll-folk! Red Ear's folk!
Hmmmrrrrrrr. Wizard lady in the tower. Red Ear sells her deals sometimes. She nice.
Brrrgh! High mighty chieftain of the soldiers. He does not come to Red Ear for deals, only sends men with laws and papers to take Red Ear's money.
Ichiba, biggest town in the Realm. Red Ear's home. Good trade, even with many criminals and soldiers and men with papers making laws. Remember - Red Ear has the best deals in Ichiba!
Red Ear's pleasure!
Hrmmmf, sneering lion-folk. He comes not to trade with Red Ear.
Red Ear does not know.
Red Ear does not know him.
Red Ear does not know.
King wizard of Gnomes. Red Ear hopes he stays in his burrow far away.
Red ear does deals not rumours.
Hmmm, Red Ear does not trust him, man who smiles with his mouth but not his eyes.
Yes! Red Ear has the best deals!
Red Ear does not know.
Red Ear does not know. Hears stories of darkness and fear. Not interested.
Red Ear does not know him.
Forest lady comes sometimes to the village. Red Ear thinks she is gone north now-a-days.
Red Ear smelled that you come from beyond the Gate! Far journey, few come to Red Ear. This place better than the other place, Red Ear thinks!
Mighty shaman of the Gnoll-people, wise in the ways of magic and wisdom!
Red Ear has heard of that place, does not know though.
Red Ear does not know him.
Red Ear does not know.
Farrr south, Red Ear has not visited the town of the Gnome-folk.
Arf! I am Red Ear!
Red Ear does not know.
Hrmmm. White castle of the lion-folk, far north of here. Red Ear does not like the unfriendly lion-folk.
Red Ear does not know about Gates.
Red Ear does not know.
The wayfarers god.
Keeper of the Gate by heritage. His line have been the wardens of Aenen for many generations.
Hmmm. The servants a The Lady are fierce warriors, and a proud people. They seek to control this Crater. But, we gnomes answer to no one. We were here first, and we shall endure.

The Maze is... always listening. Always hostile. Here deep underground we live in safety. The Leonals live behind their high walls. There is some security to be had for those willing to fight for it.

I wish you luck in your attempt to escape. If I had not the responsibility of ensuring my peoples survival, I would be tempted to join you.
He is here, in the city.
I do not know him.
I do not know him.

Hmmm. Many rumours reach me. Information is the currency of rulers.

Well. I have heard that once upon a time there was a druidess of some sort, stirring up trouble near Danaos. The leonals banished her, but I hear she is back again. Heh. I wish her well in whatever she is doing!
I am Mnesus. Called by some The Mighty. The kingship of all gnomes rests on my shoulders.
Hmmm. A figure of legend... they say he is the personfication of the Maze. When he appears, death is never far behind.
Try Mentes, or Asius on the surface.
Hmmm. If anyone is in charge in Ichiba, it is them.
Ha hah. To where? Who knows what is beyond the Maze? It might be worse...
Hmmm. I expected better of you.
A dark god, a god of winter and desolation, ruler of the underworld. May he turn his eye from us.
Hmmm, the General of the White Order. He is a skilled war leader.
I have heard that he has influence amongst the thieves in Ichiba.
He is in Ichiba.
I do not know him.
A dangerous place, if you're planning to go there. Legend has it that seven deadly spirits inhabit the wastes...
I shadowy figure of legend. I would avoid him if I were you.

Yes, we are the gnomes of Aenen. Our machines are cunning and our magic is crafty. Our warriors are skilled and pass unseen through the forests. For as long as any remember we have made a life for ourselves here in the Crater. It is not easy, but it is a life.
Hmmmm. Since the fall of Hail, all of the civilised parts of this Realm can be found here in the Crater. Beyond lies the wastelands. Beyond that, the Gate.
The gnolls are hardy folk.
She is in Ichiba, working her magicks as usual.
He is the leader of the Ichiba Chamber Of Commerce.
The chief city in the Crater. Most trade and travellers move through there. Still, I wonder at it's defences. But for the leonals and ourselves, it might already have gone the way of Hail.
A pleasure.
The sweet goddess of travel, fleet of foot, messenger of the gods.
He is in Ichiba.
He is here in the city.
I do not know how to get to the land of the fey.
Some call me The Mighty.
I do not know him.
Greetings travellers.
The holy forest? I have heard only folk tales.
Hmmm, what have I heard? I have heard of fear and danger. Terror and insanity. A dark tower, crowned with lightning. A city empty of life. Cold winds and dark skies.
He is above.
I do not know her.
Do you regret leaving your home? Well, we must all forge our own paths.
I do not know him.
The relief on the throne room doors speaks to our beliefs that even the living body is merely a complicated machine, albeit far beyond our ken.
Hail was a brave venture, foolish but initially successful. Several years back the Maze moved against the settlers in force, and they were destroyed. I have hear that a dragon inhabits the ruins now.
I do not know him.
Hmmm.
The gentle goddess of fertility, sunshine and spring time.
The city of Aenen is a safe haven. Us gnomes where here first in this Realm, in those dark days building underground was the only way to survive.
Farewell.
She is a better goddess than the leonals are worshippers, I think.
Their influence in Ichiba should not be underestimated.
The white castle, far north of here. The leonals rule, and seek to expand, their territory from there.
The Great Gate to the Third Realm lies beyond the ruins of Hail. I have stood at the entrance to the caves that lead there, but I did not enter.
Hmmm, the war god.
My sort of godling, Garret. Sometimes I would offer him a prayer..but, well, you know...I'm too busy counting loot. <grins broadly>

The tall lion folk. They're all about soldiering and law and order... I personally think that they're compensating for something... And that goddess of theirs... pretty boring folks to talk to. Boring to rob, unless you're after armour polish and scriptures of The Lady. Still, I hear there's a pile of loot in that castle of theirs...  Hmmm... now that I think about it...
What's there to say? We all get by as best we can, according to our abilities. Some of us, just a little better than others!
Never heard of 'im.
Never heard of 'im, thus couldn't care.
This is complicated game we play, personally, I just don't think you're up to it.
Me Big Gnoll Chief! Gnoll Smash! Ha ha ha! <wipes tear from his eye>
The name is Kay, Sir Kay. Humble chairman of the Ichiba Gentlemen's Social Club. A fine upstanding citizen, pillar of the community! Ha ha ha!
A legend, nothing more. But then again... so am I.
Hem. I tend towards the five fingered discount, myself... on that note, suppose I could organize you what you need...?

Ah, the merchants. Sheep to our wolves.  <grins broadly>

It's an arms race, friends, but I'm always one step ahead. That fool Pickett and his army of hirelings couldn't catch a cold on a rainy day.
Only if they catch you eh? Ha ha ha.
Congratulations, you've just discovered the last resort of the stupid. <winks>
The gloomy god of death. There's always one like that. <shakes head>
Yeah, the leonal general. Not widely known for his sense of humour, and always the last to get his own jokes.
A legendary being... me. Ha ha ha!

A cheery fellow, likeable enough for a gnome. I once permanently borrowed his purse when he passed out drunk at Scrymgeours! Found love notes from two different wenches back at Aenen, of all things! Ha ha ha!  Also, he cheats at cards. But not as well as me... not that I cheat at all! Wanna wager a hand or three...?
The gnoll shopkeeper in town? Not so bright, that one, but then none of them are. Nothing much worth stealing.

A beaurocrat born and bred. I swear, he could probably calculate compound interest in his sleep! Ha ha ha! I may be planning a heist on his fancy waterfront mansion some time soon... depending on a number of things... You interested?

Still, it was a fun town while it lasted. There was an epic pub there, the Black Dog Inn. Good times! Let's just say that there would be a few little Kay's running around in Hail, if the baddies hadn't come and wiped it out! Ha ha ha!

I am the humble chairman. <winks> We're a grouping of upstanding fellows interested in a bit of adventure and profit - with some fun and laughs thrown in. The humourless penny pinchers in the Chamber of Commerce hate us, only because jealousy makes them nasty. Ha ha ha!
